prompt: I believe that “God is the random seed.” Literally, that God is the unknowable randomness at the core of everything. I believe that faith in God is accepting that you can’t know it all, and arranging your life to benefit. How is this idea compatible with and supported by Catholicism?
title: God as “Random Seed”: Mystery and Uncertainty in Catholic and Christian Thought
sceneDescription: A solitary figure kneels in a vast, candlelit cathedral. Tiny seeds slip through their fingers, drifting upward rather than falling to the floor. The seeds hover in midair, forming shifting, almost unrecognizable patterns high above the pews. Soft beams of light from tall stained-glass windows illuminate the swirling seeds, accentuating a quiet sense of awe. The figure’s posture suggests a calm acceptance of the mysterious, as though placing trust in something beyond human grasp.
